Blackknight slightly touched his auditive sensor, where his internal 
comm unit was. He nodded.

Blackknight: Roger. I'll get some detector and look around.

He gets a detector, one looking for energy signatures, and managed to 
get out.

Blackknight: Icedemon, Arcangel, I'm going to check around. See you 
both later!

He walks slowly towards the living quarters and activated his scanner.

Blackknight: Anybody here?

--- In nbwrpg@y..., "Jonathan" <jhogan@r...> wrote:
> He slowly starts to move again. The legendary Autobot, who had 
descided to work on a Maximal ship, made his way to the bridge.
> 
> {Talos}
> Bridge
> 
> The maximal commander listened as the reports came in, the armory he 
imagined must have looked like a battle hit it. Sighing he righted 
himself in his chair more fully turning towards the two bots that had 
walked onto his bridge giving a nod of respect to Hot Rod, it had been 
a relative honor to serve alongside one of the more key figures in 
their peoples histories.
> 
> The other seemed to imply he was a criminal of some sort, he didn't 
really care in any case. "Armory is only shook up, but reports seem to 
say the thrusters are off line and quite frankly scrap. We need to get 
external sensors up and see just what kind of planet we've crashed 
ourselves on, once we can see where the slag we are we can go from 
there..."
> 
> Turning he regarded the 'criminal', "I don't know what in the Matrix 
you're talking about. You appear to believe you're in trouble with the 
law but at this point I don't give a slag what you've done. This ship 
is in bad shape, we have a mission to complete and I don't have time 
to assign personnel to guard you in a brig."
> 
>     Turning he looked the bot in the eye, "Help Hot Rod get our 
sensors up and running or report yourself to the CR chambers on deck 
two if you're too injured to help. But if you plan on sticking around 
you're gonna help us, now get to it."
> 
>     Swiveling in the chair he regarded the com, "Icedemon and 
Archangel get started on repairs on either the computers or Comm 
systems. BlackKnight check the ship for any more bots whose comms 
might be down, injuries to the CR chambers those not functioning, as 
much as I hate to say it, we'll worry about later, priority on the 
operational first."
> 
> Turning back to look out the shattered window he silently hoped 
Megatron was as bad off as they were, if the predicons launched a 
pre-emptive strike he doubted the ship could take a beating after the 
crash. Moving to the computers he began investigating the status of 
the frigates weapons and defense systems, they weren't priority one at 
the moment but he wanted at least something to re-assure the crew they 
weren't sitting blind and utterly defenseless.
